questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT
-

You have a Microsoft Teams Phone deployment.

You have routing rules for unassigned phone numbers as shown in the following exhibit.

//IMG//


You have unassigned numbers of +61370105005 and +61370105010.

Use the drop-down menus to select the answer choice that completes each statement based on the information presented in the graphic.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

//IMG//

discussion.content:
When calling +61370105005, the call will be routed based on the most specific matching pattern. In this case, the pattern ^\+761370105005$ is more specific than ^\+76137010500(0-9)$.

Therefore, the call to +61370105005 will be routed to the voice application, as it matches the exact pattern ^\+761370105005$

comments.content: Although what you mentioned is correct, but there is evaluation order as well, rules with a lower number have a higher priority and are evaluated first. Numbers can only be used once and must be between 1 and 9,999,999. Considering that, routed to person should be the answer
Calls to unassigned numbers are matched against routing rules using match patterns in the evaluation order you specify. When a match is found, the call will be routed based on the matched rule.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: CDF
D, C and F, the call park is on, on the print screen so yes the F is necessary
Is 'F' necessary? The Call Park setting is Off by default.

choices.D: Create a new call park policy named Policy1 and set Allow call park to On.
choices.A: Assign the Global (Org-wide default) policy to the users in the Help Desk group.
choices.F: In the Global (Org-wide default) policy, set Allow call park to Off.
choices.B: Create a new call park policy named Policy2 and set Allow call park to Off
choices.C: Assign Policy1 to the Help Desk group.

questions.question_text:
Your company currently allows call park for all PSTN users. The call park policies are configured as shown in the exhibit. (Click the Exhibit tab.)

//IMG//


You have a Microsoft 36S group named Help Desk.

You need to ensure that only the Help Desk group can use call park. The solution must minimize the number of policies and administrative effort.

Which three actions should you perform? Each correct answer presents part of the solution.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

discussion.content:
To add the Session Border Controller (SBC) to the tenant, you can follow these steps:

Add the domain to your Office 365 tenant:
Go to the Microsoft 365 admin center.
Navigate to Settings > Domains.
Click on Add domain and follow the instructions to add “contoso.com” to your tenant.
Create a DNS record for the SBC:
Still in the Domains page, click on the “contoso.com” domain.
Click on DNS records and then on Add DNS record.
Create a new DNS record for “sbc1.contoso.com” pointing to the IP address of your SBC.
Add the SBC to Microsoft Teams:
Go to the Teams admin center.
Navigate to Voice > Direct Routing.
Click on + Add and enter “sbc1.contoso.com” as the FQDN of the SBC.

questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP
-

You have a Microsoft Teams Phone deployment.

When you attempt to deploy a Session Border Controller (SBC) named sbc1.contoso.com, you receive the following error message: "We can't use the "SBC1.contoso.com" domain as it hasn't been set up in the organization. Try again. If you continue to have problems, contact Microsoft customer support."

You need to add the SBC to the tenant.

Which three actions should you perform in sequence? To answer, move the appropriate actions from the list of actions to the answer area and arrange them in the correct order.

//IMG//

discussion.content: Same question on the old MS-720 exam. Here is the link to reference the information. Looks like D is correct - https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/troubleshoot/phone-system/direct-routing/issues-with-call-transfers#calls-drop-before-the-transfer-is-completed

choices.D: The Refer on the SBC is misconfigured.
choices.A: NOTIFY is enabled in the SIP options of the SBC.
choices.B: The carrier rejects the format of the forwarded FROM number.
choices.C: The SSL certificate of the SBC is incorrect.

questions.question_text:
Your company has a Microsoft Teams Phone deployment that uses Direct Routing and a single carrier.

You deploy a new Session Border Controller (SBC) that shows as healthy in the Microsoft Teams admin center.

You place a test call over the new SBC. and the call succeeds.

When you attempt to transfer the call, the transfer fails. A portion of the SIP ladder is shown in the exhibit. (Click the Exhibit tab.)

//IMG//


What is a possible cause of the issue?

discussion.content: I believe that the third step is "3)For User2, set Permission to Receive calls and then set Allow changing call settings to off"

questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP
-

You have two users named User1 and User2.

You need to configure User2 as a call delegate for User1. The solution must meet the following requirements:

• Minimize disruptions to User1.
• Prevent User2 from placing calls on behalf of User1.
• Prevent User2 from modifying the settings of User1.

Which three actions should you perform in sequence? To answer, move the appropriate actions from the list of actions to the answer area and arrange them in the correct order.

//IMG//
